com.github.fge.jsonschema.syntax

Interface SyntaxChecker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSyntaxChecker, AdditionalSyntaxChecker, ContentEncodingSyntaxChecker, DivisorSyntaxChecker, DraftV3DependenciesSyntaxChecker, DraftV3PropertiesSyntaxChecker, DraftV3TypeKeywordSyntaxChecker, DraftV4DependenciesSyntaxChecker, DraftV4PropertiesSyntaxChecker, DraftV4TypeSyntaxChecker, EnumSyntaxChecker, ExclusiveMaximumSyntaxChecker, ExclusiveMinimumSyntaxChecker, FragmentResolutionSyntaxChecker, LinksSyntaxChecker, MediaTypeSyntaxChecker, NotSyntaxChecker, PatternPropertiesSyntaxChecker, PatternSyntaxChecker, PositiveIntegerSyntaxChecker, RequiredSyntaxChecker, SchemaArraySyntaxChecker, SchemaOrSchemaArraySyntaxChecker, TypeOnlySyntaxChecker, URISyntaxChecker

    public interface SyntaxChecker
    Interface implemented by all syntax checkers

    There exists one syntax checker per supported schema keyword. For the recall, their role is to ensure the keyword values are well formed, so as to ease the job of the associated keyword validator.

    You have the option to directly implement this interface, however you're probably better off extending AbstractSyntaxChecker instead.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkSyntax(SyntaxValidator validator, List<Message> messages, JsonNode schema)
      Check the syntax for this keyword

    • Method Detail

      • checkSyntax

        void checkSyntax(SyntaxValidator validator,
               List<Message> messages,
               JsonNode schema)
        Check the syntax for this keyword
        Parameters:
        validator - the syntax validator to use
        messages - message list to fill in the event of a failure
        schema - schema to analyze
